|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = SK hynix;H27U1G8F2BTR-BC; |flash1size = 128 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TQ1G63EFR-H9C; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== This would appear to be slated for use for some ''{{Used by service|AT&T}}'' customers.
The '''[[Arris]]''' logo, "592170-001 REV []", "EPR4", and "polarc ARRIS Inc. :2013" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
The WiSoC used in this device has integrated 2.4 GHz + 5 GHz radios.. :"592171-001-4" is etched onto the bottom of the board.
{{WiFiCert|WFA50808|10/31/2013}}
The power adapter shown in the FCC photos is a '''Motorola''' :branded NBS24G120200VU / P/N: 57961-024-00 :(100-120VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.6A -> 12VDC, 2.0A).
==Links of Interest== *[https://sourceforge.net/arris/nvg595/home/Home/ ''Arris NVG595'' on '''SourceForge'''] :README for building the NVG595 images. This tarball also contains :the Broadcom code drop ''bcm963xx_4.06L.03_consumer_release.tar.gz'', :which was created using Broadcom's source code redistribution process *[http://www.dslreports.com/forum/r29817828-U-Verse-Bussiness-installation-tomorrow-What-equipment-need-to-be-installe ''Arris NVG595'' on '''DSLReports''' forums] :WAN is using the SFP, Wi-Fi is wierd, it has one radio that :can do either 2.4GHz or 5GHz but not both at the same time
[[Category:English Documentation]]
